quote: ‘Thank you’ is the best prayer that anyone could say. I say that one a lot. Thank you expresses extreme gratitude, humility, understanding.
author: Alice Walker

quote: A great man is one who has not lost the child’s heart.
author: Mencius

quote: A happy soul in a happy body.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: A very interesting theory makes no sense at all.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Advantages never comes free. You have to create it the way you want it!
author: Ashish Patel

quote: All things excellent are as difficult as they are rare.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: An eye for an eye only ends up making the whole world blind…
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Anyone who has never made a mistake, has never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Architecture is the thoughtful making of space.
author: Louis Kahn

quote: At some point, you have to stop running and turn around and face whoever wants you dead.The hard thing is finding the courage to do it.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: Be kind to one another.
author: Jim Henson

quote: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a battle.
author: Plato

quote: Be thankful for what you have; you’ll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don’t have, you will never, ever have enough.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Believe nothing, O monks, merely because you have been told it … or because is it traditional, or because you yourselves have imagined it. Do not believe what your teacher tells you merely out of respect for the teacher. But, whatsoever, after due examination and analysis, you find to be conducive to the good, the benefit, the welfare of all beings–that doctrine believe and cling to, and take it as your guide.
author: Buddha

quote: Build your own dreams, or someone else will hire you to build theirs.
author: Farraj Gray

quote: Despite your best efforts, not everyone wants to be helped. Make a difference where you can and be at peace with the rest.
author: Gary Hopkins

quote: Do just once what others say you can’t do and you will never pay attention to their limitations again.
author: James R. Cook

quote: Do not do to others what angers you if done to you by others.
author: Socrates

quote: Don’t ever forget that a small group of thoughtful people can change the world, it’s the only thing that ever has.
author: Aaron Sorkin

quote: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
author: Robert Brault

quote: Even when we do not actively participate in our destiny, we are still on a chosen path. Life has a way of making decisions for us.
author: Nina Guilbeau

quote: Every day, a new opportunity to decide where your next step will go is given to you. Your future will be determined by the accumulation of these daily decisions. You control your steps and therefore your destiny, so choose wisely.
author: Kevin Ngo

quote: Every thoughtful and kind-hearted person must regard with interest any device or plan which promises to enable at least the more intelligent, enterprising, and determined part of those who are not capitalists to cease to labor for hire.
author: Leland Stanford

quote: Everyone has inside them a piece of good news. The good news is you dont know how great you can be! How much you can love! What you can accomplish! And what your potential is.
author: Anne Frank

quote: Experience is not what happens to you; it’s what you do with what happens to you.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it.
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: Good manners are not merely snobbish ornaments, as Mrs. Lippett’s regime appeared to believe. They mean self-discipline and thought for others, and my children have got to learn them.
author: Jean Webster

quote: Gratitude is the healthiest of all human emotions. The more you express gratitude for what you have, the more likely you will have even more to express gratitude for.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: He who spends too long regretting his ruined crop will be neglect to plant next year’s harvest.
author: François Lelord

quote: Human nature is like water. It takes the shape of its container.
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: Humility is not thinking less of yourself, it’s thinking of yourself less.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: I am certain of nothing but of the holiness of the heart’s affections, and the truth of the Imagination.
author: John Keats

quote: I can’t go back to yesterday because I was a different person then.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: I have a life without you. You’re not my entire world. You’re just the part I loved the most…
author: S.C Stephens

quote: I have spread my dreams under your feet; Tread softly, because you tread on my dreams.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: I know of no more encouraging fact than the unquestionable ability of man to elevate his life by conscious endeavor.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: I think we all do have a guardian angel. I believe they work through us all the time, when we are thoughtful and good and kind to each other.
author: Roma Downey

quote: I would maintain that thanks are the highest form of thought, and that gratitude is happiness doubled by wonder.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: I’m very thoughtful, and when I make a decision I usually stick to it.
author: Casey Stoner

quote: If you don’t like something change it; if you can’t change it, change the way you think about it…
author: Mary Engelbreit

quote: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.
author: Rene Descartes

quote: It has been my experience that rewarding and heart-breaking often go hand in hand.
author: Holly Sloan

quote: It is not the strongest of the species that survives, nor the most intelligent. It is the one that is most adaptable.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: It is so shocking to find out how many people do not believe that they can learn, and how many more believe learning to be difficult.
author: Frank Herbert

quote: It is time for us all to stand and cheer for the doer, the achiever – the one who recognizes the challenges and does something about it.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: It’s important to be thoughtful and mindful about the things you say to other people.
author: Evan Spiegel

quote: It’s not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
author: Epictetus

quote: Learn to recognize the false dawn from the true; distinguish the color of the wine from the color of the cup. Then it may be that patience and time may produce, out of the spectrum-viewing sight, true vision, and you will behold colors other than these mortal hues, you will see pearls instead of stones. Pearls, did I say? Nay more, you will become a sea, you will become a sun traveling the sky.
author: Jalal Al-Din Rumi

quote: Life is going to beat you up, it wouldn’t be fair if you didn’t throw some punches back at it.
author: Bradley Bowman

quote: Life isn’t about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Living well is the best revenge.
author: George Herbert

quote: Many a time I have wanted to stop talking and find out what I really believed.
author: Walter Lippman

quote: Nature, more of a stepmother than a mother in several ways, has sown a seed of evil in the hearts of mortals, especially in the more thoughtful men, which makes them dissatisfied with their own lot and envious of another’s.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it’s the only thing that ever has.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Never underestimate the power of thought; it is the greatest path to discovery.
author: Idowu Koyenikan

quote: No matter how bad things are, you can always make things worse.
author: Randy Pausch

quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent…
author: Rosa Parks

quote: Nobody, as long as he moves about among the chaotic currents of life, is without trouble.” – Carl Jung“None is more impoverished than the one who has no gratitude. Gratitude is a currency that we can mint for ourselves, and spend without fear of bankruptcy.
author: ” – Fred De Witt Van Amburgh

quote: Now and then, it is good to pause in our pursuit of happiness and just be happy.
author: Guillame Apollinaire

quote: One wondering thought pollutes the day.
author: Mary Shelley

quote: Only one who takes over his own life history can see in it the realization of his self. Responsibility to take over one’s own biography means to get clear about who one wants to be.
author: Jürgen Habermas

quote: Reflect upon your present blessings, of which every man has plenty; not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Reflect your thoughts and watch others mirror them back to you.
author: Stephen Richards

quote: Respect for self is the beginning of cultivating virtue in men and women.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: Some days seem to fit together like a stained glass window. A hundred little pieces of different color and mood that, when combined, create a complete picture.
author: Maggie Stiefvater

quote: Some people grumble that roses have thorns; I am grateful that thorns have roses.
author: Alphonse Karr

quote: Sometimes the road less traveled is less traveled for a reason.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: Sow an act, and you reap a habit. Sow a habit, and you reap a character. Sow a character, and you reap a destiny.
author: Charles Reade

quote: Stop the habit of wishful thinking and start the habit of thoughtful wishes.
author: Mary Martin

quote: Storms don’t come to teach us painful lessons, rather they were meant to wash us clean.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: Thankfulness is the beginning of gratitude. Gratitude is the completion of thankfulness. Thankfulness may consist merely of words. Gratitude is shown in acts.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: The first and final thing you have to do in this world is to last it and not be smashed by it…
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money…
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The least of things with a meaning is worth more in life than the greatest of things without it.
author: Carl Jung

quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven’t found it yet, keep looking. Don’t settle.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: The purest and most thoughtful minds are those which love color the most.
author: John Ruskin

quote: The quieter you become, the more you can hear.
author: Baba Ramdas

quote: The roots of all goodness lie in the soil of appreciation for goodness.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of his wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: The thoughtful soul to solitude retires.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: The way to develop the best that is in a person is by appreciation and encouragement.
author: Charles Schwab

quote: The whole is more than the sum of its parts.
author: Aristotle

quote: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: There is never a right time. Except the time we make right.
author: Richmond Akhigbe

quote: There is no exercise better for the heart than reaching down and lifting people up.
author: John Holmes

quote: There is nothing wrong with the love of Beauty. But Beauty – unless she is wed to something more meaningful – is always superficial.
author: Donna Tartt

quote: There’s nothing wrong with enjoying looking at the surface of the ocean itself, except that when you finally see what goes on underwater,you realize that you’ve been missing the whole point of the ocean. Staying on the surface all the time is like going to the circus and staring at the outside of the tent.
author: Dave Barry

quote: To understand the heart and mind of a person, look not at what he has already achieved, but what he aspires to.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: We all know so much, and yet at the same time we don’t know anything.
author: Grace Fiorre

quote: We are always the same age inside.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: When I started counting my blessings, my whole life turned around.
author: Willie Nelson

quote: When someone tells me ‘no,’ it doesn’t mean I can’t do it, it simply means I can’t do it with them.
author: Karen E. Quinones Miller

quote: Whenever you’re going through a tough time, generally, you become more compassionate, you become softer, you become more thoughtful, kinder. These are all spiritual qualities that will help you to align yourself with God and God consciousness rather than with a split fear-based consciousness.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Writing makes it easier to cope with life.
author: Mary Sage Nguyen

quote: You are, after all, what you think. Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: You can’t understand where someone’s going unless you understand where they’ve been.
author: Jerry B. Jenkins

quote: You cannot push anyone up the ladder unless he is willing to climb.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: You cannot step into the same river twice, for other waters are continually flowing on.
author: Heraclitus

quote: You get to a point where you have to start planning, when you cross that line where you have enough value to get someone’s movie made if you attach yourself to it, you have to be very thoughtful and have to plan.
author: Chris Pratt

quote: Your breath upon the wind shall surely lodge within some breast. Ask not whose breast it is. See only that the breath itself be pure.
author: Mikhail Naimy
